page.title: 12Events. Historical Pageant.
page.content: This week we celebrated the 500th anniversary of Henry Tudor's march to Bosworth. We all dressed up in Middle Ages costumes, as knights and archers, lords or peasants. We joined other schools, and walked around the Celtic Fort of Beacon Ring on Long Mountain where Henry camped with his followers. We went on to another school where we had a typical picnic lunch of those days. It was great fun. Then we put on entertainment for each other. Our school performed a Miracle Play. Others did jousting, dancing and so on. Then we finished this exciting day by going round the stalls of a Middle Age Fair. There were stocks too. We had free sweets at a comfit stall, and there were free pony rides. We wish all history lessons were as exciting!
